DataElement.preferredName: Number Mathematical Operator Comparison Operator Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification._A symbol or mathematical function that represents a specific action. For example, a plus sign (+) is an operator that represents addition. The basic mathematic operators are + addition, - subtraction,* multiplication,/ division. In addition to these operators, many programs and programming languages recognize other operators that allow you to manipulate numbers and text in more sophisticated ways. For example, Boolean operators enable you to test the truth or falsity of conditions, and relational operators let you compare one value to another._The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences._A symbol used to perform an arithmetic or logical operation._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification._A symbol or mathematical function that represents a specific action. For example, a plus sign (+) is an operator that represents addition. The basic mathematic operators are + addition, - subtraction,* multiplication,/ division. In addition to these operators, many programs and programming languages recognize other operators that allow you to manipulate numbers and text in more sophisticated ways. For example, Boolean operators enable you to test the truth or falsity of conditions, and relational operators let you compare one value to another.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

Property.preferredDefinition: A symbol or mathematical function that represents a specific action. For example, a plus sign (+) is an operator that represents addition. The basic mathematic operators are + addition, - subtraction,* multiplication,/ division. In addition to these operators, many programs and programming languages recognize other operators that allow you to manipulate numbers and text in more sophisticated ways. For example, Boolean operators enable you to test the truth or falsity of conditions, and relational operators let you compare one value to another.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or mathematical function that represents a specific action. For example, a plus sign (+) is an operator that represents addition. The basic mathematic operators are + addition, - subtraction,* multiplication,/ division. In addition to these operators, many programs and programming languages recognize other operators that allow you to manipulate numbers and text in more sophisticated ways. For example, Boolean operators enable you to test the truth or falsity of conditions, and relational operators let you compare one value to another.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences._A symbol used to perform an arithmetic or logical operation._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._The natural number greater than forty-four and less than forty-six and the quantity that it denotes._The length of a person's life, stated in years since birth.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
The natural number greater than forty-four and less than forty-six and the quantity that it denotes.
The length of a person's life, stated in years since birth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being the same in quantity or measure or value or status.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being the same in quantity or measure or value or status.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition of not being equal.

Concepts.definition: The condition of not being equal.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._The natural number greater than forty-four and less than forty-six and the quantity that it denotes._The length of a person's life, stated in years since birth.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
The natural number greater than forty-four and less than forty-six and the quantity that it denotes.
The length of a person's life, stated in years since birth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.:A symbol used to perform an arithmetic or logical operation.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

A symbol used to perform an arithmetic or logical operation.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
